comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
I'm definitely very new to PackageManagement etc., but I'm trying to use this to install a module provided as a NuGet package, specifically [Invoke-Build](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Invoke-Build).

``` powershell
> Get-PackageSource                                      
WARNING: Unable to find package sources.

> Register-PackageSource -Provider NuGet -Name NuGet.org -Location https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json                                   

Name                             ProviderName     IsTrusted  Location          
----                             ------------     ---------  --------          
NuGet.org                        NuGet            False      https://api.nug...

> get-package -Provider NuGet Invoke-Build               
get-package : No package found for 'Invoke-Build'.
At line:1 char:1
+ get-package -Provider NuGet Invoke-Build
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (Microsoft.Power...lets.GetPacka 
   ge:GetPackage) [Get-Package], Exception
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NoMatchFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.PackageManagem 
   ent.Cmdlets.GetPackage

> Get-PackageSource                                      
WARNING: Unable to find package sources.
```

I probably just did something wrong, but I thought I registered the package source. I couldn't set it, and couldn't use it. @raghushantha how do you do this?

comments.author: quoctruong
comments.body: Hi @andschwa, currently you cannot register package source with NuGet provider on Linux yet because we have not mapped the windows location where we store our package source over. Currently, you can directly  use it to find packages on nuget.org or powershellgallery.com with "Find-Package -provider nuget -source https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/" or "find-package -provider nuget -source https://www.powershellgallery.com/api/v2/"
